de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions
Class Expression

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.Expression
All Implemented Interfaces:
PrettyPrintPriorities, PrettyPrintable, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
And, Application, Condition, Condition1, CurriedLet, Exn, InfixOperation, Let, List, MultiLet, Or, Recursion, Sequence, Tuple, Value, While
public abstract class Expression
extends Object
implements Cloneable, PrettyPrintable, PrettyPrintPriorities

Base class for all classes in the expression hierarchy.

Version:
$Rev: 698 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
PrettyPrintable

Constructor Detail

Expression

public Expression()
Method Detail

clone

public abstract Expression clone()
Clones this expression, so that the result is an expression equal to this expression, but with a different object identity. This is used in the substitution of expressions to be able to distinguish different appearances of the same identifier in the pretty printer, as required by the highlighting of bound variables. But note that for certain kinds of Expressions, like Constants, this method returns the same object, as constants are not affected by the highlighting of bound variables.

Overrides:
clone in class Object
Returns:
a deep clone of this object, or a reference to this if the expression is a constant or another special kind of expression not affected by the highlighting of bound variables.
See Also:
Object.clone()

containsMemoryOperations

public final boolean containsMemoryOperations()
Returns true if the expression contains any of the memory operations, that is either Assign.ASSIGN, Deref.DEREF or Ref.REF. Otherwise false will be returned. This method is used for the InterpreterProofModels to enable the InterpreterProofModel.isMemoryEnabled() property depending on whether the expression at the root node contains memory operations or not. This method uses the levelOrderEnumeration() method to traverse all sub expressions, so this method does not need to be implemented by any derived class, but it'll work automagically.

Returns:
true if the expression contains any of the memory operations, false otherwise.
See Also:
children(), levelOrderEnumeration()

free

public Set<String> free()
Returns the free (unbound) identifiers within the expression, e.g. the name of the identifier for an identifier expression or the free identifiers for its sub expressions in applications, abstractions and recursions. The default implementation in the Expression class uses introspection to determine the sub expressions and calls free() recursively on all sub expressions. Some of the derived classes might need to override this method if they represents a binding mechanism, like Let, or if they don't have sub expressions, but provide free identifiers, like Identifier.

Returns:
the set of free (unbound) identifiers within the expression.

isException

public boolean isException()
Returns true if the expression should be considered an exception in the big and small step interpreters and must thereby not be evaluated any futher, nor must any operation be performed on exceptions. The default implementation in the Expression class simply returns false, so derived classes will need to override this method if their instances should be considered values under certain circumstances.

Returns:
true if the expression is an exception, false otherwise.

isValue

public boolean isValue()
Returns true if the expression should be considered a value in the big and small step interpreters and must thereby not be evaluated any further. The default implementation in the Expression class simply returns false, so derived classes will need to override this method if their instances should be considered values under certain circumstances.

Returns:
true if the expression is a value, false otherwise.

substitute

public Expression substitute(TypeSubstitution substitution)
Applies the type substitution to this expression, to be exact, to the types within this expression, and returns the new expression with the new types. If the expression does not contain any types, this method simply returns a reference to this expression.

Parameters:
substitution - the type substitution to apply.
Returns:
the resulting expression.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if substitution is null.

substitute

public abstract Expression substitute(String id,
                                      Expression e)
Substitutes the expression e for the identifier id in this expression, and returns the resulting expression. The resulting expression may be a new Expression object or if no substitution took place, the same object. The method operates recursively.

Parameters:
id - the name of the identifier.
e - the Expression to substitute.
Returns:
the resulting expression.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if id or e is null.

toPrettyString

public final PrettyString toPrettyString()
Returns a PrettyString that can be used to represent this printable object, and extract information about possible other printables contained within this object.

Specified by:
toPrettyString in interface PrettyPrintable
Returns:
the pretty string for this printable.
See Also:
PrettyPrintable.toPrettyString()

toPrettyStringBuilder

public abstract PrettyStringBuilder toPrettyStringBuilder(PrettyStringBuilderFactory factory)
Returns the pretty string builder used to pretty print this expression. The pretty string builder must be allocated from the specified factory, which is currently always the default factory, but may also be another factory in the future.

Parameters:
factory - the PrettyStringBuilderFactory used to allocate the required pretty string builders to pretty print this expression.
Returns:
the pretty string builder used to pretty print this expression.
See Also:
toPrettyString(), PrettyStringBuilder, PrettyStringBuilderFactory

children

public final Enumeration<Expression> children()
Returns an enumeration for the direct ancestor expressions, the direct children, of this expression. The enumeration is generated using the bean properties for every Expression derived class. For example, Application provides getE1() and getE2(), and thereby the sub expressions e1 and e2. It also supports arrays of expressions, as used in the Tuple expression class.

Returns:
an Enumeration for the direct ancestor expressions of this expression.

levelOrderEnumeration

public Enumeration<Expression> levelOrderEnumeration()
Returns an Enumeration that enumerates the expression within the expression hierarchy starting at this expression in level order (that is breadth first enumeration).

Returns:
a breadth first enumeration of all expressions within the expression hierarchy starting at this item.

toString

public String toString()
Returns the string representation for this expression. This method is mainly used for debugging.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
the pretty printed string representation for this expression.
See Also:
toPrettyString(), Object.toString()
